column39: 1/ Household Survey on Travel and Tourism (EVyTH) projected to the total resident population.
1/ Holiday and business trips with at least one overnight stay, including stays at friends and relatives and second homes.

1/ Resident tourists staying in all types of accommodation establishments.
2/ Package tour.
1/ Due to a change in the methodology, from 2015 the data are not comparable with those of previous years.
1/ Until 2017: Travel Survey of Residents of Canada. 2018: change in the methodology. From 2018: National Travel Survey. The data are not comparable with those of previous years.
1/ 2016: change in the methodology. The data are not comparable with those of previous years.
1/ Source: CBS, Survey on Tourist Activity of Population of Republic of Croatia. 2015: provisional data.
1/ Data from 2012 onwards results from the Survey on Domestic and Outbound Trips of Residents of the Statistical Service of Cyprus, as extracted from the Eurostat website.
1/ Source: Domestic and Outbound Tourism Survey and TSA.
1/ Source: Eurostat.
1/ Finnish Travel survey.
1/ Source: DGE. Survey Follow-up of tourism demand (SDT). Resident population aged 15 years and above; trips in Overseas Departments are counted together with those abroad.
1/ Data indicate the number of trips, not the number of visitors.
1/ Source: Eurostat.
1/ Number of trips (personal and professional) with 1 or more overnights by visitors aged 15+.
1/ 2014: break in the series due to the change data collection technique (survey: "Trips and Holidays"), from CATI to CAPI.
1/ From 2012 source: Household survey.
1/ Resident tourists staying in all types of accommodation establishments; including youth hostels, tourist private accommodation and others.
1/ Domestic tourism survey.
1/ Source: Eurostat.
1/ Excluding the left side of the river Nistru and the municipality of Bender.

1/ The Domestic Tourism survey is a module of the Household Budget Survey which is conducted every 5 years and in 2008/2009 was the first time that the domestic tourism appeared in this survey. In 2012/2013 was held the Continuous Household Budget Survey.
1/ 2021: break in the series due to methodological changes in the survey.
1/ Domestic Travel Survey, MBIE (discontinued in 2013).
1/ Source: Statistics Norway - Travel Survey.
1/ Data from Central Statistical Office.
1/ Source: Statistics Portugal (INE), Travel Survey of Residents.
1/ Only domestic trips for holidays (including visit friends and relatives VFR) and business purposes.
1 From 2021: new methodology integrating traditional data sources (Household surveys), Mobile Positing Data (MPD), and Point of Sale (POS) to calculate number of domestic tourism trips.
1/ Source: survey on travels of domestic population (due to different methodology differences between data on monthly accommodation statistics and data gathered with household survey may appear).
1/ Source: Domestic Tourism Survey.
1/ Due to a change of supplier, domestic and outbound tourism statistics are not available for 2014-2016. From 2017: Swedish Travel Survey.
1/ Domestic tourism survey conducted every 2 years.
1/ Source: Turkstat Household Domestic Tourism Survey.

Note 2019: the source of the data changed and therefore, are not comparable with those of previous years. New sources: The Federal Authority for Identity and Citizenship, Economic Survey, Household income and expenditure survey, Mirror statistics for GCC data and Tourism surveys done by local tourism authorities.
1/ From 2013: Great Britain only (not including Northern Ireland) and Day Visit survey.

1/ Source: U.S. Travel Association. Includes all domestic trips of 50 or more miles from home one-way or any overnight trip.
2/ Approximately 50%.
1/ Based on Domestic and Outbound Tourism Survey data.

column4: The information is the same as that provided in the "Compendium of Tourism Statistics"
